triples.name: Biodiversity
triples.relevance: The paper studies how biodiversity and ecosystem dynamics emerge and reinforce each other in microbial communities.

triples.name: Microcosm (experimental ecosystem)
triples.relevance: Bacterial microcosms serve as the experimental system for testing ecological theory predictions about community dynamics.

triples.name: Phase transition
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates that microbial ecosystems transition between three distinct dynamical phases as species richness or interaction strength changes.

triples.name: Population dynamics
triples.relevance: The paper studies fluctuations in species abundances over time, which is central to understanding population dynamics in ecological communities.

triples.name: Coexistence theory
triples.relevance: The paper examines transitions from states of stable coexistence to partial coexistence to sustained fluctuations in species abundances.

triples.name: Emergence
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates that emergent phases and predictable patterns of diversity and dynamics arise from simple community-level features in ecological systems.
